keyPractices.description: Make the data generated while conducting SLR available

practiceInstances.description: Make quality assessment data available for synthesis in systematic reviews

textPassages.text: Should the academic community also support the principle of making detailed data available for synthesis in a systematic review? We believe that it should, at the very least insofar as quality assessment is part of the systematic review process.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

practiceInstances.description: Make data supporting reported claims available upon request for synthesis in systematic reviews

textPassages.text: We would support a call for a principle of academic research that data supporting claims made in a report or paper should be made available by researchers upon request, for synthesis in systematic reviews.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

Dimensions.Description: This dimension ensures the quality and effectiveness of the tools used in the review.

keyPractices.description: Adopt tools, methods, procedures adequate for the researcher's experience

practiceInstances.description: GRADE is not recommended for new researchers

Dimensions.Description: This dimension ensures that all processes to validate each process of SLR (e.g., scope definition, protocol definition, studies selection, data extraction, data synthesis).

keyPractices.description: Develop appropriate strategies for quality assessment strategies

textPassages.text: Appropriate guidelines are required for devising quality assessment strategies

practiceInstances.description: Incorporate credibility aspects into quality assessment criteria

practiceInstances.description: Develop quality criteria aligned with assessment purpose, not blindly

textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

practiceInstances.description: Assess the quality of primary studies based on the type of systematic literature review undertaken

keyPractices.description: Perform primary studies quality assessment in SLRs

textPassages.text: Hence, it is important that SLRs researchers start paying more attention to the quality assessment of the papers included in SLRs.
textPassages.study_title: Quality assessment of systematic reviews in software engineering: a tertiary study
textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

keyPractices.description: Integrates manual and automated search strategies

practiceInstances.description: Adopt quasi-gold standard (QGS)

textPassages.text: In order to exhaustively identify SLRs with quality assessment component and ensure that the process of papers selection was unbiased as far as possible, the approach of quasi-gold standard (QGS) was adopted, which systematically integrates manual and automated search strategies and suggests a relatively rigorous approach for search performance evaluation in terms of sensitivity and precision.
textPassages.study_title: Quality assessment of systematic reviews in software engineering: a tertiary study
textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

keyPractices.description: Address publication bias

textPassages.text: the search strategy should attempt to address publication bias by trying to find publications that report negative results.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

practiceInstances.description: Address publication bias in the search strategy by including studies with negative results

textPassages.text: the search strategy should attempt to address publication bias by trying to find publications that report negative results.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

practiceInstances.description: Identify multiple reports of the same study and seek missing or unpublished data from authors

textPassages.text: multiple reports of the same study should be identified, and missing or unpublished data should be sought from the publications’ authors.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

keyPractices.description: Follow the process described in the protocol

practiceInstances.description: Perform data extraction according to the systematic review protocol

practiceInstances.description: Follow the selection process described in the protocol

keyPractices.description: Address the researcher's bias

practiceInstances.description: Check the reliability of the selection process

textPassages.text: checking the reliability of this selection process, in order to reduce the risk of researcher bias.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

keyPractices.description: Use sensitivity analyses to determine the effect of excluding low-quality publications
Address search & selection bias

practiceInstances.description: Select and justify a search strategy appropriate for the research question.

textPassages.text: There are alternative search strategies that enable you to achieve different sort of search completion criteria. You must select and justify a search strategy that is appropriate for your research question.

textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

practiceInstances.description: Review conclusions as well as abstracts when selecting primary studies

textPassages.text: The standard of IT and software engineering abstracts is too poor to rely on when selecting primary studies. You should also review the conclusions.

textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

Dimensions.Description: This dimension ensures that all the interactions among researchers and the target audience are well-performed.

textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

textPassages.text: disagreements in selection should be discussed and resolved

textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

practiceInstances.description: Check duplicates independently by at least two researchers to minimize bias

textPassages.text: To ensure the removal of these duplicates, each retrieved paper was checked and further read by at least two researchers independently to handle the duplication and limited bias as much as possible.
textPassages.study_title: Quality assessment of systematic reviews in software engineering: a tertiary study
textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

textPassages.text: We assigned the workload to make sure that each study was checked by at least two researchers independently to minimize the potential impact of any bias.

textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

practiceInstances.description: Escalate unresolved disagreements to a supervisor

textPassages.text: Any disagreements that could not be solved were escalated to the supervisor.

textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

practiceInstances.description: Resolve disagreements on search and selection through joint discussion

textPassages.text: The disagreements on search and selection opinions were solved in joint discussion

textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

keyPractices.description: Perform cross-checks with reviewers (independent, supervisors, team-members) for data extraction

textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

practiceInstances.description: Perform data extraction by at least two researchers and resolve disagreements by consensus or additional reviewers

practiceInstances.description: Record the specific search string used for each resource

practiceInstances.description: Report only the final protocol design and provide commentary on changes made

keyPractices.description: Publish a full report separately from a journal overview paper when reporting systematic reviews

textPassages.text: we have provided the full report as an institutional technical report (Niazi and Staples, 2006), and are preparing a separate journal paper that will include an overview of the methodology and results of the systematic review. We believe this a satisfactory approach for reporting systematic reviews.

keyPractices.description: Ensure study contributes value to research or practice

textPassages.text: Is the study of value for research or practice?
textPassages.study_title: Quality assessment of systematic reviews in software engineering: a tertiary study
textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

keyPractices.description: Apply snowballing as a complementary search to avoid missing relevant studies

textPassages.text: ...we also used the snowballing as the complementary search to reduce the possibility of missing relevant SLRs.
textPassages.study_title: Quality assessment of systematic reviews in software engineering: a tertiary study
textPassages.study_authors: Zhou,  You and Zhang,  He and Huang,  Xin and Yang,  Song and Babar,  Muhammad Ali and Tang,  Hao

keyPractices.description: Apply the well-established guidelines for SLR

textPassages.text: Overall we recommend the guidelines
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

keyPractices.description: Define complementary research questions to clarify the main questions

textPassages.text: We suggest that complementary research questions can help clarify the main questions and define selection criteria.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

textPassages.text: We also found that it was very helpful to define complementary research questions that were not being investigated, so as to clarify the boundaries of our research question of interest.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

practiceInstances.description: Identify the unit of analysis (i.e. to be explicitly clear whether you are studying organizations, teams, or individuals) explicitly when defining research questions

textPassages.text: an instance of our recommendation to define complementary research questions is to clearly identify the unit of analysis for the research question, i.e. to be explicitly clear whether you are studying organizations, teams, or individuals.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

keyPractices.description: Perform a pilot test in the SLR protocol

practiceInstances.description: Pilot aspects of the protocol during its development

textPassages.text: Kitchenham recommends in several places that aspects of the protocol should be piloted during its development.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

practiceInstances.description: Review the protocol itself because it is critical for the systematic review

textPassages.text: Review the protocol itself because it is critical for the systematic review.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

practiceInstances.description: Pilot the research protocol to find mistakes and refine the methodology

textPassages.text: Piloting the research protocol is essential. It will find mistakes in your data collection and aggregation procedures. It may also indicate that you need to change the methodology you intend to use to address the research questions.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

keyPractices.description: Trial search terms, selection criteria, and data extraction procedures before finalizing the protocol

textPassages.text: the search terms, selection criteria, and data extraction procedures should all be trialled before finalising the protocol.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

keyPractices.description: Use a formal search strategy to identify all relevant publications

textPassages.text: A formal search strategy (described in the protocol) is used to find the entire population of publications that may be relevant to the research questions.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

keyPractices.description: Determine how quality assessment will be used in data aggregation and analysis

textPassages.text: It is important to be sure how the quality assessment will be used in the subsequent data aggregation and analysis.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

keyPractices.description: Revise research questions during protocol development as understanding increases

textPassages.text: Expect to revise your questions during protocol development, as your understanding of the problem increases experiences with the revision of research questions during systematic review.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood

Dimensions.Description: This dimension handles all aspects related to optimization of SLR process to make it less costly in terms of time and effort needed.

keyPractices.description: Define research questions clearly and narrowly to reduce effort and improve selection and data extraction

textPassages.text: We recommend researchers clearly and narrowly define research questions to reduce overall effort, and to improve selection and data extraction.
textPassages.study_title: Experiences Using Systematic Review Guidelines
textPassages.study_authors: Staples,  Mark and Niazi,  Mahmood
